oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1952-09-20 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 20, 1952. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Red Foley (host/performer) and performers Rod Brasfield, Smiley Burnette, the Old Hickory Singers, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Next week's guest announced as being Sue Thompson.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Rod Brasfield; Smiley Burnette
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Freight Train Boogie (Red Foley) -- Opening statement (Red Foley, Grant Turner) -- Red Foley introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Red Foley) -- Prince Albert commercial -- Red Foley introduces Smiley Burnette -- It's My Lazy Day (Smiley Burnette) -- Red Foley talks -- The Last Mile Of The Way (Red Foley)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Old Hickory Singers; Minnie Pearl; Burnette, Smiley, 1911-1967; Brasfield, Rod; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Thompson, Sue, 1925-
